p: Labdane compounds have a molecular formula C 20H 38 with an average mass of 278.516 Da ( Figure 8). Labdane-related molecules have a hydrocarbon skeleton, originated from dual biosynthetic cyclization and/or rearrangement reactions, produced through the biosynthetic pathway of gibberellin phytohormones by the diterpene cyclases. The labane diterpenoids belong to a superfamily of natural products, in which the hydrocarbon skeleton might serve as privileged scaffolds for their biological activity [ 210].
